abstract: A class that renders a preview of a Look Around view.
overview:
## Discussion

Use a `mapkit.LookAroundPreview` to create preview imagery for a specific geographic location on the map.

The following example contains the two elements needed to display a Look Around view on a webpage:



The HTML code below implements a webpage that renders a `container` which has both a map and a Look Around preview.

The JavaScript listing below implements a MapKitJS map object that the web page displays inside the `<div id="map">` element of the page, with a Look Around preview displays inside the `<div id="container">` element. The code centers the map on the area near the New York Public Library in New York City using a PlaceID. The Look Around preview on the map shows a view of The New York Public Library building. For more information on obtaining a PlaceID for a specific location. For more information on Place IDs, see [https://developer.apple.com/maps/place-id-lookup/].

## Handling Look Around loading states

LookAroundPreview object dispatches the following events:
rawMarkdown:
--- source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/MapKitJS/LookAroundPreview crawled: 2025-12-02T16:43:04Z --- # LookAroundPreview **Class** A class that renders a preview of a Look Around view. ## Declaration ```swift class LookAroundPreview extends AbstractLookAround ``` ## Discussion Use a `mapkit.LookAroundPreview` to create preview imagery for a specific geographic location on the map. The following example contains the two elements needed to display a Look Around view on a webpage: The HTML code below implements a webpage that renders a `container` which has both a map and a Look Around preview. ```html
``` The JavaScript listing below implements a MapKitJS map object that the web page displays inside the `
` element of the page, with a Look Around preview displays inside the `
` element. The code centers the map on the area near the New York Public Library in New York City using a PlaceID. The Look Around preview on the map shows a view of The New York Public Library building. For more information on obtaining a PlaceID for a specific location. For more information on Place IDs, see [https://developer.apple.com/maps/place-id-lookup/]. ```javascript async function initializeMapKitJS() { if (!window.mapkit || window.mapkit.loadedLibraries.length === 0) { await new Promise(res => window.initMapKit = res) delete window.initMapKit } } (async () => { await initializeMapKitJS(); // Look Around view code const placeLookup = new mapkit.PlaceLookup(); const place = await new Promise( resolve => placeLookup.getPlace( // The New York Public Library, 42nd St & 5th Ave,New York, NY "I88F02FEA4499C61D", (error, result) => resolve(result) ) ); const lookAround = new mapkit.LookAroundPreview( document.getElementById("container"), place ); const map = new mapkit.Map("map", { center: place.coordinate, cameraDistance: 7000, showsPointsOfInterest: false, annotations: [ new mapkit.PlaceAnnotation(place, { selected: true }) ] }); })() ``` ## Handling Look Around loading states LookAroundPreview object dispatches the following events: - `load`: A DOM `Event`. The Look Around view loaded. - `error`: A [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/LookAroundErrorEvent]. The Look Around view encountered an error, for example, in an unsupported browser, or a location with no Look Around imagery. - `readystatechange`: A DOM `Event`. The ready state changed. - `open-dialog`: A DOM `Event`. The Look Around view is about to expand. - `leave-dialog`: A DOM `Event`. The Look Around view is about to contract. - `close`: A DOM `Event`. A person interacted with the close control. ## Creating a Look Around preview - **new LookAroundPreview(parent, location, options)**: Creates a Look Around preview you embed on a webpage and initializes it with the constructor options you choose. ## Controlling the interactions with a Look Around view - **isNavigationEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether someone can navigate inside the Look Around view. - **isScrollEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether someone can scroll the Look Around view. - **isZoomEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether someone can zoom the Look Around view. ## Controlling additional information the Look Around view displays - **showsPointsOfInterest**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the Look Around view shows points of interest (POIs). - **showsRoadLabels**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the Look Around view shows road labels. ## Positioning a badge - **badgePosition**: A value you set to specify the position of a badge on the Look Around preview. - **LookAroundBadgePosition**: Values that control the positions of a badge on a Look Around preview. ## Controlling the LookAround dialog - **openDialog**: Opens the Look Around view in a dialog. ## Getting information about the Look Around object and its state - **element**: A property that represents the Look Around view’s containing Document Object Model (DOM) element. - **scene**: The Look Around scene the framework is displaying. - **padding**: The padding options for the Look Around view. - **readyState**: A value that represents the loading state of the Look Around object. - **LookAroundReadyState**: Values that indicate the state of the Look Around object in the browser. ## Closing and releasing a Look Around view - **destroy()**: Releases the Look Around view and its resources from memory. ## Static properties - **BadgePositions**: A static property that allows you to access the Look Around ready state enumeration. - **ReadyStates**: A static property that allows you to access to access the look around ready state enumeration. ## Instance Methods - **destroy()**: Destroys the Look Around view and releases its resources. ## Exploring at street level - **LookAround**: A view that allows someone to see a street level view of a place. - **LookAroundOptions**: Options for initializing a LookAround view. - **LookAroundPreviewOptions**: Options for initializing a LookAroundPreview object. - **LookAroundScene**: Object that represents the current location of the view. - **CommonLookAroundOptions**: Options that control the behavior of Look Around views. - **AbstractLookAround**: An abstract class that provides a common interface for Look Around views. - **lookAroundViews**: A list of all the Look Around objects that are currently active on a page. ## Inherits From - AbstractLookAround
